title: Visualisation of Gene Expression Within the Context of Tissues: an X-Ray Computed Tomography-Based Multimodal Approach
content: In developmental and cell biology, understanding the spatial distribution of gene activity offers new insights into developmental processes within an organism and the underlying mechanisms of diseases. Visualizing molecular mechanisms within their natural context is often challenging and limited to small histological tissue sections. Here, we introduce a novel method for correlative light sheet microscopy and X-ray microtomography, enabling simultaneous localization of fluorescent markers and visualization of tissue architecture with cellular resolution in organisms and organoids with hundreds of micrometres in size.
